string-array.name: recipe_instructions_chicken_alfredo
string-array.item: 1. Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
2. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently.
3. Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Let the mixture simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until melted and well combined.
5. Add the sliced chicken and cooked pasta to the saucepan and toss until well coated with the sauce.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

string-array.name: recipe_ingredients_beef_stroganoff
string-array.item: 1 pound beef sirloin, sliced into thin strips

string-array.name: recipe_instructions_beef_stroganoff
string-array.item: 1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
2. Add the chopped onion to the same skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
3. Pour in the beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
4. Add the browned beef back to the skillet and let the mixture simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
5. Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve the beef stroganoff over cooked egg noodles.
